==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|ぼ|yomi=o|さつ}}

===Etymology===
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=ほさつ'}}, originally as abbreviation of full term {{l|ltc|菩提薩埵}}, itself a [[transliteration]] of {{etyl|sa|ja|sort=ほさつ'}} {{m|sa|बोधिसत्त्व|tr=bodhi-sattva||enlightened existence}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|acc=a|acc2=h|ぼさつ|y=o}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|ぼさつ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=ほさつ'|Buddhism}} [[bodhisattva]]
# {{lb|ja|obsolete|sort=ほさつ'}} in ancient Japan, a [[title]] granted by the [[imperial]] [[court]] to notably [[virtuous]] high-ranking [[monk]]s
# {{lb|ja|archaic|sort=ほさつ'}} a [[title]] applied to native [[Shinto]] gods, after the spread of {{m|ja|本地垂迹|tr=honji suijaku|pos=[[theological]] position prevalent until the [[w:Meiji_period|Meiji period]], explaining that Indian Buddhist [[deity|deities]] choose to appear in Japan as native ''[[神#Japanese|kami]]''}}
# alternate name for {{m|ja|米|tr=kome||rice}}
# by extension of the {{m|en|rice}} meaning, a [[maidservant]] who [[cook]]s rice

* {{pedia|Honji suijaku}}
